title: 1 Pound
description: Oi! You picked me, didnâ€™t you? Good choice â€” Iâ€™ve got some weight to me.

messages.text: I was born in 2017 â€” a tough little twelve-sider with high-tech roots. Royal Mint calls me the most secure coin in the world. Not bad, eh?

Right? It's called a dodecagon â€” fancy word for â€œnot round.â€ Makes me harder to fake. Plus, Iâ€™ve got a latent image, micro-lettering, and even a hidden security feature they wonâ€™t tell you about. Like a spy, but shinier.
What metals are used in it?
What was the old pound coin like?
It was round and less secure.
Is the old pound still valid?
No, it was demonetised. Too many fakes circulating
Whatâ€™s on the back of the coin?

Front: Queen Elizabeth II â€” rest her soul.ğŸ•Šï¸

Back: Four nations united â€” rose, leek, thistle, and shamrock sprouting from a single stem.

Designed by a 15-year-old, believe it or not.

Thanks. I may be small, but I carry centuries of symbolism â€” monarchy, unity, trade, everyday life.

Youâ€™ve probably used me to buy crisps, a bus ticket, or maybe nothing at all in a cashless world. Still, I persist.
Do you miss being used more?
Maybe. But I like my new role here â€” telling my story. Being seen. Being heard.ğŸ˜Š
Just this: Donâ€™t overlook the small things. They might be carrying empires in their pockets.
